summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell. The government notifies the defense that it will argue Maxwell has waived any insanity or mental condition defense under Federal Rule of Criminal Procedure 12.2 due to missing the notice deadlines. The government demands any such notice by October 20, 2021, if the defense intends to proceed.

keyFacts: The government asserts that Ghislaine Maxwell has waived any defense based on mental disease or defect under Federal Rule of Criminal Procedure 12.2 due to missing notice deadlines.
The deadlines for pretrial motions (January 25, 2021) and supplemental pretrial motions (May 7, 2021) had passed without the government receiving any Rule 12.2 notice from the defense.

The government demands that if Maxwell intends to offer such evidence, notice must be provided by October 20, 2021, to allow the government time to respond and potentially seek a court-ordered examination.
The letter is signed by U.S. Attorney Damian Williams and addressed to multiple defense attorneys representing Maxwell.
The document is a formal legal communication in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
